intro: Hieracium basiserratum, commonly known as the roughleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of rough, serrated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowering stems rise from the center of the rosette, bearing yellow flower heads that bloom in late summer. Hieracium basiserratum is typically found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun.
